News.title: Brazil's federal public debt falls 1.28% in April to 4.16 trln reais - Treasury
News.description:
Brazil's federal public debt
fell 1.28% in April to 4.16 trillion reais ($785 billion) from
the month before, the Treasury said on Wednesday.

News.title: Canada housing market may start recovery from virus impact by mid-2021 - CMHC
News.description:
Canadian housing starts, sales
and prices are expected to start to recover by mid-2021 as the
coronavirus pandemic recedes, but the precise timing and
duration of that rebound is highly uncertain, Canada's national
housing agency said on Wednesday.

News.title: US STOCKS-S&P 500 rises on boost from bank shares
News.description:
* Indexes mixed: Dow 1.09%, S&P 0.44%, Nasdaq off 0.45%
(Updates to early afternoon)

News.title: Fed's Bullard: Expanded unemployment pay not appropriate as recovery takes hold
News.description:
Expanded unemployment
benefits were an appropriate policy during the coronavirus shut
down but would not be appropriate as the recovery takes hold,
St. Louis Federal Reserve president James Bullard said on
Wednesday.

News.title: UPDATE 4-Trump threatens social media shutdown over Twitter fact-check label
News.description:
U.S. President Donald Trump
on Wednesday threatened to regulate or shut down social media
companies for stifling conservative voices, a day after Twitter
attached a warning to some of his tweets prompting readers to
fact check the president's claims.

News.title: UPDATE 5-"Europe's Moment": EU lays out costly rescue for squabbling bloc
News.description:
* Comes with proposed 2021-27 EU budget worth 1.1 trillion
euros

News.title: UPDATE 4-"Move on" - British PM tries to draw line under adviser row
News.description:
* Cummings says: No regrets as I acted reasonably
(Adds comments on the economy)

News.title: Ackman says portfolio is up as much as 27%, sold Berkshire recently
News.description:
Billionaire investor William
Ackman told investors on Wednesday that his funds have gained as
much as 27% this year and that the stocks he already owns are
still cheap after the coronavirus sparked a historic market sell
off in March.

News.title: Russia says postpones July BRICS summit due to coronavirus
News.description:
Russia said on Wednesday it has
decided to postpone the summit of the BRICS nations, initially
scheduled to be held in St. Petersburg in July, due to the
spread of the coronavirus.

News.title: UPDATE 2-Exxon shareholders soundly reject splitting CEO/chairman roles
News.description:
Exxon Mobil Corp shareholders
soundly rejected climate-related proposals and splitting the
chairman and chief executive's roles at the oil major's
shareholder meeting on Wednesday.

News.title: Euro zone shares supported by recovery plan, banks jump
News.description: Euro zone stocks were buoyed on Wednesday by a 750-billion-euro ($824 billion) plan to prop up EU economies hammered by the coronavirus crisis, but falls for healthcare and technology stocks weighed on broader European markets.

News.title: UPDATE 3-Euro zone shares supported by recovery plan, banks jump
News.description:
* Renault soars after plans to deepen cooperation with
Nissan
(Updates to market close)

News.title: FOREX-Dollar steadies against euro; yuan slips on U.S.-China tensions
News.description:
* Yen, Swiss franc under pressure
(New throughout, updates prices, market activity, comments to
U.S. market open; new byline, changes dateline; previous LONDON)

News.title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Euro, stocks retreat from rally on EU stimulus plan
News.description:
The euro retreated from near
two-month highs and equity markets wavered on Wednesday even as
the European Union unveiled a 750 billion euro ($823 billion)
recovery fund that helped offset concerns about unrest in Hong
Kong over Beijing's proposed security laws.

News.title: FOREX-Euro rallies on EU recovery fund proposals, yuan falls
News.description:
* Graphic: World FX rates in 2019: http://tmsnrt.rs/2egbfVh
(Adds details, quotes, latest prices)

News.title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Stocks, euro rise on massive EU stimulus plan
News.description:
World shares surged on
Wednesday as reports of a European Union rescue fund helped
offset concerns about unrest in Hong Kong over Beijing's
proposed national security laws.

News.title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Hong Kong unrest worries curb global shares rally
News.description:
Unrest in Hong Kong over
Beijing's proposed national security laws weighed on global
shares and oil prices on Wednesday, offsetting optimism about
the re-opening of the world economy.

News.title: FOREX-Dollar gains and yuan hits 9-month low as U.S.-China tensions return
News.description:
The U.S. dollar edged higher on
Wednesday and China's yuan hit a near nine-month low as worries
about the U.S. response to China's proposed security law for
Hong Kong injected a more cautious tone into foreign exchange
markets.

News.title: MORNING BID-Stocks rally soldiers on as Hong Kong protests flare up
News.description:
A look at the day ahead from emerging markets chief
correspondent Karin Strohecker. The views expressed are her own.

News.title: European shares edge higher, focus on EU recovery plan
News.description:
European shares inched higher on
Wednesday as investors focused on a fresh stimulus plan for the
European Union, while renewed U.S.-China tensions over Hong Kong
tempered optimism about a global economic recovery.

News.title: GLOBAL MARKETS-Asian shares defy global rally as Hong Kong unrest rattles investors
News.description:
* Hopes of economic re-opening support developed market
shares

News.title: FOREX-Dollar gains, yuan takes hit as Hong Kong simmers
News.description:
The dollar edged higher on
Wednesday as worries about the U.S. response to China's proposed
security law and renewed protests in Hong Kong supported
safe-haven demand for the greenback.

News.title: Travel firms propel European stocks to strongest close in 11 weeks
News.description: European shares closed at an 11-week high on Tuesday, with travel and leisure stocks soaring on hopes of a revival in tourism as countries gradually reopened after a months-long lockdown.

News.title: UPDATE 2-Travel firms propel European stocks to strongest close in 11 weeks
News.description:
* Measures to help French autos sector worth 8 bln euros
(Updates to market close)

News.title: European shares near 11-week high, UK stocks surge
News.description:
European shares hovered near a 11-week
high on Tuesday, with UK markets surging after a long weekend,
as businesses worldwide gradually reopened following a
months-long lockdown.

News.title: FOREX-Dollar gains, yuan slumps on rising Hong Kong tensions
News.description:
The dollar edged higher on
Wednesday as worries about the U.S. response to China's proposed
security law for Hong Kong supported safe-haven demand for the
greenback.

News.title: German stocks outperform Europe as business morale rebounds
News.description: European shares rose in thin trade on Monday as a closely watched indicator of German business sentiment rebounded in May, with a slew of positive corporate updates boosting sentiment.

News.title: UPDATE 2-German stocks outperform Europe as business morale rebounds
News.description:
* Lagardere jumps as LVMH's Arnault to buy stake
(Updates to market close)

News.title: LIVE MARKETS-Closing snapshot, solid gains in thin volumes
News.description:
Welcome to the home for real-time coverage of European equity
markets brought to you by Reuters stocks reporters. You can
share your thoughts Joice Alves (joice.alves@thomsonreuters.com)
and Julien Ponthus (julien.ponthus@thomsonreuters.com) in London
and Stefano Rebaudo (stefano.rebaudo@thomsonreuters.com) in
Milan.

News.title: LIVE MARKETS-No signs of V-shaped German recovery, yet
News.description:
Welcome to the home for real-time coverage of European equity markets brought to you by Reuters
stocks reporters. You can share your thoughts Joice Alves (joice.alves@thomsonreuters.com) and
Julien Ponthus (julien.ponthus@thomsonreuters.com) in London and Stefano Rebaudo
